original: Elofsson, Martin, komminister, Lan-naskedebrunn, f. 18/8/02 i Ljuder, Kronob. 1., av Carl E. o. Hilda Petersson. G. 35 m. Ingeborg Håkan&son. — Stud :ex. i Lund 27, teol. fil. ex. där 28, teol. kand. samt prakt. teol. prov 31, prästv. f. Växjö stift 32. Pastors-adj. i Kalvsvik o. Jät 32-33, v. pastor i Llallaryd 33-35, i Ljuder 35, v. kommin. i Nävelsjö s. å., kommin. där sed. 36. Ordf. i kyrkostämma, skots tyr. o. bibl:styr., led. av komm:fullm. o. bar-nav:nd, ordf. i komm:fullm. o. kom-m:st., ordf. i Nävelsjö föreläsn :fören.
translated: Elofsson, Martin, parish minister, Lan-naskedebrunn, born on August 18, 1902 in Ljuder, Kronoberg County, son of Carl E. and Hilda Petersson. Married in 1935 to Ingeborg Håkansson. He completed his studies at Lund University, receiving a Bachelor's degree in Theology in 1927 and a Master's degree in Theology in 1928. He also completed his practical theological training and was ordained as a priest for Växjö diocese in 1932. He served as a pastor's assistant in Kalvsvik and Jät from 1932 to 1933, then as a deputy pastor in Llallaryd from 1933 to 1935 and in Ljuder in 1935, and was appointed deputy parish minister in Nävelsjö the same year, becoming full parish minister in 1936. He was chairman of the church assembly, school board and library board, member of the municipal council and child welfare board, and chairman of the municipal council and municipal committee. He was also chairman of the Nävelsjö lecture association.
